title: March 14
description:
Lucie's in France this week for work. Austin's moved in to help wrangle the kids, for which Dean will be eternally grateful.

Austin, Dean and the boys are living the bachelor lifestyle. So far, this means:

  • Legos have taken precedence over food on the kitchen table.
  • Plates became optional somewhere along the line.
  • Pizza forms a King Tut-sized chunk of the food pyramid.
  • Bathing was never our strong suit, but... let's just say we're doing our bit to eliminate California's drought.

Also, and I'm not sure if this is bachelor-ey or not, but we've discovered milkshakes. Not only are they tasty, you get to operate the blender!

children.title: Austin
children.description: Whatever nutrition is happening this week is due to this man.

children.title: Wii
children.description:
This week has been good for Dean's Nintendo Wii skills. He and Austin have been egging each other on to ever-higher heights.

The best part: all the games are done standing on the Wii Balance Board, so it counts as exercise!

children.title: Julie
children.description:
When Julie stopped by for a visit, the boys were eager to show her their sporting attire.

Felix hopes to test for his yellow stripe belt this coming week. Milo is starting a new soccer team.

children.title: Julie 2
children.description: Both boys are getting skills:  Milo can dribble and trap the ball, Felix has his set of karate routines down cold.

children.title: Lego
children.description: Much of Saturday was spent constructing a LEGO Star Wars spaceship.

children.title: Lego 2
children.description: Construction of the 1000+ piece ship proceeded at a brisk pace.

children.title: Lego 3
children.description: Negotiating a tricky part of the ion particle engine assembly.

children.title: Club Penguin
children.description:
Milo has fallen hard for Club Penguin.

Club Penguin is an online world/game/social network for kids. We decided to see what the fuss was about when we realized Felix and Milo might quite literally have been the only people in their classes not to have logged in.

For the last 4 days, Milo's been obsessed. Dean is strictly rationing Milo's time on it, but the rest of the time Milo's dreaming about his Puffles (little furry virtual pets) or about an online card game called Card-Jitsu.

Turns out Card-Jitsu's an actual card game so we bought a pack and have been playing it in the real world. It involves more strategy than Felix and Milo are used to in their games, so Dean's been happy to find an educational component to Milo's addiction. We've been discussing tactics over meals.
